meanings.definition: A member of a traditionally itinerant ethnic group in Eastern Europe.
meanings.sent1: The tzigane traveled from place to place, carrying their belongings with them.
meanings.sent2: I met a friendly tzigane family at the market today.
meanings.sent3: The tzigane group decided to have a picnic in the park, showcasing their nomadic spirit.
meanings.sent4: Her free-spirited nature made her feel like a tzigane wandering through life.
meanings.sent5: The colorful clothes of the tzigane brightened up the dull street.

meanings.definition: A style of music and dance associated with the Romani people.
meanings.sent1: The lively tzigane music filled the air, making everyone want to dance.
meanings.sent2: She performed a beautiful tzigane dance at the cultural festival.
meanings.sent3: The tzigane melody had everyone tapping their feet in joy.
meanings.sent4: His fingers moved on the guitar strings like a skilled tzigane musician.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic beats of the tzigane music echoed through the room.
